channel.title: Is there a way to make 5/4 time signature?
channel.description: Please help i want to make it so bad

item.title: Is there a way to make 5/4 time signature?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Probably, but what use is it understanding something if it isn’t particularly accurate?

Better, imo, to start from correct, then find a way to expressly simply - without sacrificing accuracy, or at least without leaving important gaps.

But, maybe that’s just me.

 
Some things are just complex.

Explaining alt time signatures is already a complex issue to start with. Trying to explain how to fake them in Auxy only compounds the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Is there a way to make 5/4 time signature?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
The word I’d use is more ‘accurate’.

What you said didn’t touch upon the ‘losing sync’ aspect and seemed to conflate the number of beats in a bar with the number of bars in a sequence.

item.title: Is there a way to make 5/4 time signature?
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
akabillposters:

So I’m clear, you’re suggesting that someone who wants to use an alt time sig should suck it up and do it in Auxy, to demonstrate to Lenberg the value of supporting alt time sigs?

I would love to see it personally and see what is possible. It could prove it.

akabillposters:

‘Impressing’ Lenberg is already hit and miss.

True :\ It’s worth a chance though in some ways, at least how I see it. I’d love that option.

Read full topic

item.title: Is there a way to make 5/4 time signature?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
TheRealJFalc:

I’d disagree, it does depend on the type of person you are though.

You’re right. I’m the kind of person that will use a tool that I don’t have to fight with.

I really like Auxy, but I’m not married to it.

 

maybe if someone made it work it would make Lenpai consider alternate key signatures.

So I’m clear, you’re suggesting that someone who wants to use an alt time sig should suck it up and do it in Auxy, to demonstrate to Lenberg the value of supporting alt time sigs?

‘Impressing’ Lenberg is already hit and miss. There are a great many things that people are putting time and effort into that aren’t moving Lenberg’s opinion on things.

Read full topic
item.source: Is there a way to make 5/4 time signature?

item.title: Is there a way to make 5/4 time signature?
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
I’d say if you want to do something, then do it.

I didn’t have the option for a 7/8 time signature, I did it anyway. Three times actually. One time in a demo, then two times in my Re/Mastered EP,, in the intro song and the ending song, which just so happened to also include a makeshift 3/4 time portion.

akabillposters:

To clarify, to emulate a 5/4 signature in Auxy, you will need to use 8-bar patterns, using only the first 5 bars, and then set section length to 5 in the sidebar.

Unfortunately, this ‘faking it’ approach means your 5-bar (8) pattern will go ‘out of sync’ with the bars UI in the app, as you’ll effectively be delaying the start of the next bar by one beat every time. This causes a knock-on effect that takes 5 bars in Auxy to resolve cleanly.

So, it’s doable, but it’s messy (in Auxy).

It’s doable and messy. But I’d say if you really want to, and have the patience for it, and can make it work, then do it. I don’t think I was able to accomplish it very well but I still did it and I was happy with it. Hey, maybe if someone made it work it would make Lenpai consider alternate key signatures. spoiler

akabillposters:

It isn’t worth the pain.

I’d disagree, it does depend on the type of person you are though.

Read full topic

item.title: Is there a way to make 5/4 time signature?
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
akabillposters:

Personally, if you’re attempting the above, I’d use something other than Auxy. It isn’t worth the pain.

Beatmaker 3, Cubasis, Auria and Aum are all capable of 5/4.

Garageband is limited to 4/4, 3/4 and 6/8.

item.title: Is there a way to make 5/4 time signature?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
That’s not a 5/4 signature. That’s just a 5-bar loop.
(See my previous reply.)

Read full topic
item.source: Is there a way to make 5/4 time signature?

item.title: Is there a way to make 5/4 time signature?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
That, on its own, is not what a 5/4 time sig means.
A 5/4 time sig would be like a simple 4/4, but with an extra beat per bar.

What you’re suggesting is an extra bar per pattern.

To clarify, to emulate a 5/4 signature in Auxy, you will need to use 8-bar patterns, using only the first 5 bars, and then set section length to 5 in the sidebar.

Unfortunately, this ‘faking it’ approach means your 5-bar (8) pattern will go ‘out of sync’ with the bars UI in the app, as you’ll effectively be delaying the start of the next bar by one beat every time. This causes a knock-on effect that takes 5 bars in Auxy to resolve cleanly.

So, it’s doable, but it’s messy (in Auxy).

https://app.auxy.co/projects/rsoYkPUGNAENCLmwHaoT1Q==

 
If you wanted to do a 5/4 signature, in Auxy, with repeating segments that don’t use 4 bars (actual bars, not Auxy UI bars), then you’re in for a world of pain as you have to use a really horrible patchwork of bars and loop lengths to get it done.

Personally, if you’re attempting the above, I’d use something other than Auxy. It isn’t worth the pain.

Read full topic
